properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Geelong Cats at the SCG. First bounce from 7:50pm, full-time around 10:30pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavy on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match during Friday evening peak. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.45pm and will remain closed until crowds have safely cleared the precinct.

Access EP2 Kippax grass car park via Moore Park Rd and access EP3 Showground Field grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: NRL - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Warriors at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 12.10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Bulldogs at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 6pm, full-time around 8pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - BATHURST Great Western Highway at Bentinck Street, Havannah Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Knights at Carrington Park in Bathurst. Kick off from 3pm, full-time around 5pm. 

Allow extra travel time on Havannah St, Great Western Hwy, William St and Sydney Rd.

Motorists exercise caution and should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Sydney FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm and full-time around 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Roosters at Accor Stadium. Preliminary game from 5.40pm. NRL kick-off from 8.05pm, full-time around 10pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: A-League - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Wellington Phoenix v Perth Glory at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 3.05pm, full time at 5.05pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Adelaide United at Central Coast Stadium. Kick-off around 7:45pm and full-time approx 9:45pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from before the game between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Concerts - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Macquarie Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
On Saturday the Sydney Symphony Under the Stars will be taking place from 7pm until 9:20pm and on Sunday the Rock in the Park will be taking place from 4pm until 9pm in Parramatta Park. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on both days on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as music fans travel to Parramatta Park each evening. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

properties.headline: Special event - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Professional Bull Riders Newcastle Origin 1 at Newcastle Entertainment Centre. Show starts from 7:30pm and finishes around 11pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the Entertainment Centre. The right hand turn from Griffith Rd into the Entertainment Centre may be restricted during the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Soccer match - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women Grand Final: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time approx. 5:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

webLinks.linkText: Snowy Classic 2022 Interactive Road Closure Map

properties.headline: Snowy Classic cycle event - JINDABYNE Kosciuszko Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 cyclists will take part in the 170km Maxi Classic and 110km Challenge Classic from 8am. Both rides start and finish at Banjo Patterson Park in Jindabyne and travel via Rocky Plain, Berridale, Dalgety and Beloka. The 170km ride continues to Perisher before returning to Jindabyne.

Major Road closures (please visit the Cycling Classics website for more detailed road closure information).

  • Jindabyne - between 5am and 7pm: sections of Kosciuszko Rd between Banjo Paterson Cres/Thredbo Tce & Barry Way at Banjo Patterson Park will be closed from 5am until 9:30am and from 5pm until 7pm. Local detours will be in place. From 9:30am until 5:30pm traffic will be reduced to one lane in both directions using northern/lake side lanes and the speed limited will be reduced 40km/h.
  • Jindabyne to East Jindabyne – 7:15am to 9:15am: Kosciuszko Rd from Munyang Street/Banjo Patterson Cres to Eucumbene Rd closed. 
  • East Jindabyne to Rocky Plain – 7:15am to 10am: Eucumbene Rd from Kosciuszko Rd to Rocky Plain Rd closed.
  • Rocky Plain to Berridale - between 8am and 11.10am: Rocky Plain Rd from Eucumbene Rd to Middlingbank Rd, Middlingbank Rd between Rocky Plain Rd and Jindabyne Rd closed.
  • Berridale to Dalgety - between 8.30am and 12.45pm: Myack St, Dalgety Rd and Campbell St from Jindabyne Rd to the Snowy River Way closed.
  • Dalgety to Jindabyne - 9am to 2pm: Snowy River Way from Campbell St, Dalgety to Barry Way closed. Barry Way closed from 9:45am from Snowy River Way to Kosciuszko Rd, Jindabyne.
  • Jindabyne to Perisher - 10am to 5.15pm: Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Perisher Village closed. No access to or from Perisher until 5.15pm.

Local roads will also be closed and access will be restricted, follow directions of traffic control on site.

Motorists should expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time along the detour routes.

webLinks.linkText: Snowy Classic 2022 Interactive Road Closure Map

properties.headline: NRL - WOOLOOWARE Captain Cook Drive at PointsBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Knights at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 6pm and full-time around 8pm. 

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd during the already busy Friday evening peak. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Rabbitohs at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 8.05pm and full-time approx. 10pm. Preliminary games from 4pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: A-League - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 7:05pm and full-time approx. 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - MUDGEE Ullan Road at Lue Road
properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Mudgee CBD and surrounding townships to and from the stadium.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Raiders at Glen Willow Stadium, Mudgee. Kick-off at 5:30pm and full-time around 7:30pm. Preliminary games from 3pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual through Mudgee and along Ulan Rd, Lue Rd and Church St as crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

No public parking will be permitted at the venue or on Pitts Lane on game day.

properties.headline: Race day - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Championships Day 1 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 12:10pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads around Randwick Racecourse:     

  • From 4am to 7pm on Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm on Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides) 
  • From 3pm to 7pm on High St between UNSW Gates Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: AFL & Music Festival - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Gold Coast Suns @ GIANTS Stadium. First bounce from 1:10pm and finish around 3:40pm. 

Good Life Music Festival @ Accor Stadium starting from 4pm and finishing around 10pm. 

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Dragons at Commbank Stadium. NRL kick-off from 6:15pm and full-time around 8pm. Preliminary game from 3:50pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close ahead of full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Festival - NORTH WOLLONGONG George Hanley Drive and Cliff Road at Stuart Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Yours & Owls Festival is taking place at Stuart Park in North Wollongong starting from 12pm on both days, finishing at 11pm on Saturday and 10pm on Sunday. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Bourke St, Kembla St, Memorial Dr, Squires Way, Princes Hwy and Corrimal St as crowds travel to and from the event.

Motorists should also exercise caution on local roads around the concert site as increased pedestrian activity is expected.

roads.mainStreet: George Hanley Drive and Cliff Road

properties.headline: NewRun - NEWCASTLE Wharf Road, Watt Street and Memorial Drive to Bar Beach
properties.publicTransport: Route 21 buses will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Runners will participate in a marathon, half marathon, 10km, 5km or 2km events in the annual NewRun - Newcastle Running Festival starting from 6am at Queens Wharf travelling around the foreshore to finish back at Market St Lawn. The Hill to Harbour 10km run will start from Bar Beach at 8.30am also finishing at Market St Lawn.

Road Closures will be in place between 4am and 11:30am on sections of roads around the event course. Roads will be progressively re-opened as the last runner has passed through. 

  • 4am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Argyle St
  • 5.30am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5am to 11.30am - Shortland Espl from Zaara St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5.30am to 9.15am - Memorial Dr from Bar Beach Ave to Kilgour Ave

Traffic is expected to be heavy between 5am and 10am as participants arrive and between 1pm and 3pm as they leave the area. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time while in the area and to follow the direction of traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Road, Watt Street and Memorial Drive

properties.headline: Cycling event - MUDGEE TO DUBBO via Castlereagh Highway, Golden Highway, Newell Highway, Oxley Highway, Kamilaroi Highway, Mitchell Highway and Barrier Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 30 cyclists will be participating in the Toyota Tour de OROC from Monday 21 March to Saturday 26 March riding from Mudgee to Dubbo via Armatree, Walgett, Bourke, Cobar and Warren.

Cyclists will share the road with motorists on highways including; Castlereagh Highway, Golden Highway, Newell Highway, Oxley Highway, Kamilaroi Highway, Mitchell Highway and Barrier Highway, as well as other local roads. 

Motorists should allow extra time and exercise caution as they share roads along the course with cyclists during the event. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: via Castlereagh Highway, Golden Highway, Newell Highway, Oxley Highway, Kamilaroi Highway, Mitchell Highway and Barrier Highway

webLinks.linkText: Central Coast Council - Love Lanes Festival 2022

properties.headline: Love Lanes Festival - WYONG Pacific Highway at Alison Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Changed traffic conditions will be in place in Wyong for the annual Love Lanes Festival. The event will be held across four laneways in Wyong CBD from 4pm to 9pm.

The following roads will be closed from 6am to 11pm:

  • Alison Rd between Pacific Hwy and Margaret St
  • Bakers Ln between Pacific Hwy and Rankens Ct
  • Hely St between Plaza Ln and Alison Rd 
  • Robleys Ln between Pacific Hwy and Alison Rd 
  • Peters Ln and Rankens Circuit.

There will be no access to Alison Rd, Bakers Ln and Robleys Ln from the Pacific Hwy during this time. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected along the Pacific Hwy at Wyong before and after the event.

webLinks.linkText: A Day on The Green - Bowral

properties.headline: Music concert - BOWRAL Old Hume Highway, Mittagong Road approaching Centennial Road
properties.publicTransport: Local shuttle buses will run from Bowral and Mittagong, check the event website for more details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend A Day On The Green concert featuring Crowded House at Centennial Vineyards in Bowral from 3.15pm to 8pm.

The speed limit will be reduced along Mittagong Rd approaching the site from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow on Mittagong Road at Kirkham Rd.

Lane closures and speed reductions will be in place on The Old Hume Highway approaching Centennial Rd from 12pm until midnight. Traffic controllers will be on site to manage traffic flow along The Old Hume Highway.

properties.headline: Run2Cure Charity fun run - SYDNEY Art Gallery Road at Hospital Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Run2Cure fun run events will take place in The Domain starting from 7.30am

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching The Domain as participants travel to and from the event.

Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie’s Rd will be closed from 5am to 11.30am. No vehicle access or parking will be permitted until roads are reopened.

Hospital Rd will remain open with limited parking and a drop off zone located immediately south of the pedestrian crossing on the corner of Hospital Rd and Phillip Path. Parking is available in the Domain car park.

properties.headline: Festival & Parade - COWRA Kendal Street/Mid Western Highway between Lachlan Street AND Darling Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Cowra Festival of International Understanding is taking place from Thursday 31 March until Sunday 3 April.

On Saturday 2 April while a street parade is taking place Kendal St/Mid Western Hwy between Lachlan St and Darling St will be closed between 2:30pm until 4:30pm. Other local roads will also be closed. 

Motorists will be detoured via College Dr, Liverpool St and Lachlan St in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Special event - MURRURUNDI New England Highway between Wades Lane AND Boyd Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Murrunrundi Railway 150 Year Anniversary celebrations will be taking place in Murrurundi on Saturday and Sunday. 

For the safety of pedestrians the New England Hwy between Wades Lane and Boyd St will have a reduced speed limit of 40km/h from 10am until 8pm on Saturday and 10am until 2pm on Sunday. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and exercise caution as pedestrian activity in the area will be busy.

properties.headline: A-League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Melbourne City at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 7.45pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: NRL - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Sharks at WIN Stadium. Kick off from 805pm, full-time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: Australia v Japan Soccer match - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Tickets include return travel on public transport. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Australia v Japan: FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 AFC Asian Qualifiers at Stadium Australia. Kick-off from 8.10pm, finish around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the stadium during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park are closed between 1am Thursday 24 March and 2am Friday 25 March including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Shane Gould Ave, Grande Pde, Kevin Coombs Ave, Shirley Strickland Ave, Herb Elliott Ave and Edwin Flack Ave.

Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and follow directional signage for available parking on-site.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK 

From 1am Thursday 24 March until 2am Friday 25 March

  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Showground Rd to Edwin Flack Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Ave to Kevin Coombs Ave (road will remain closed until 1am Sunday 27 March)

From 11am Thursday 24 March until 2am Friday 25 March 

  • Showground Rd from Grand Pde to Dawn Fraser Ave
  • Murray Rose Ave from Showground Rd to Gate 15
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Ave to Sarah Durack Ave
  • Shane Gould Ave from P2A to Olympic Blvd
  • Grand Parade from Australia Ave to Olympic Blvd
  • Kevin Coombs Ave from Australia Ave to Pondage Link
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Rod Laver Dr to Olympic Blvd
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Olympic Blvd to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Dr from Shirley Strickland to the Tennis Centre

From 2pm Thursday 24 March until 2am Friday 25 March

  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Park St to Showground Rd
  • Showground Rd from Herb Elliot Ave to Dawn Fraser Ave (Novotel Loading Dock)
  • Herb Elliot Ave from Olympic Blvd to Showground Rd
  • Murray Rose Ave from Showground Rd to Park Street

From 8pm until 11pm

  • Herb Elliot Ave from Park St to Showground Road
  • Edwin Flack Ave from Birnie Ave to Old Hill Link (northbound)
  • Edwin Flack Ave from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Police Operation - CAMPERDOWN TO CENTRAL City Rd, Broadway, George St, Pitt St, Eddy Ave
properties.publicTransport: Buses and light rail services may experience delays while closures are in place. Check service alerts for the latest info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place from Camperdown to Central between 10.45am and 11.30am for a planned Police Operation protest march.

Closures will be in place along City Rd northbound lanes, Broadway eastbound lanes, George St northbound lanes, Railway Square, Pitt St northbound lanes and Eddy Ave eastbound lanes.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

roads.mainStreet: City Rd, Broadway, George St, Pitt St, Eddy Ave
